Class Heap<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractQueue<E>
        • java.util.PriorityQueue<E>
          • Heap<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Heap<E>>, java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.Queue<E>
    public class Heap<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends java.util.PriorityQueue<E>
implements java.lang.Comparable<Heap<E>>
    Heap Class with extend features like searching for an element, merging heaps, removing ith largest element and extended iterator class with set method.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Heap​(java.util.Comparator<? super E> comp)
      Creates a Heap with the capacity 7 that orders its elements according to the specified comparator.

        public Heap​(java.util.Comparator<? super E> comp)
        Creates a Heap with the capacity 7 that orders its elements according to the specified comparator.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • merge

        public void merge​(Heap<E> other)
           throws java.lang.ClassCastException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Merge this heap with another heap.
        Parameters:
        other - heap for merging 2 heaps.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the class of an element of the specified Heap prevents it from being added to this heap.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - - if the specified Heap contains a null element and this Heap does not permit null elements, or if the specified collection is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if some property of an element of the specified Heap prevents it from being added to this queue, or if the specified collection is this queue
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - if not all the elements can be added at this time due to insertion restrictions

      • removeLargestIth

        public E removeLargestIth​(int index)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Remove ith largest element from the Heap.
        Parameters:
        index - is the ith element order which will be removed from the heap.
        Returns:
        the removed element if it does exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if parameter is out of bounds of the heap.

      • display

        public void display()
        display the heap.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Heap<E> o)
        Compares peek values of the heaps.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
        Parameters:
        o - other heap to compare.
        Returns:
        1 if heap's peek is bigger, -1 if smaller and 0 if they're equal.
